intro: Carex lindleyana, commonly known as Lindley’s sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. This species typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, bogs, and along stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Carex lindleyana is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support wetland biodiversity.
